clinical_study.brief_title: Mobile Strategies for Women's and Children's Health: Optimizing Adherence and Efficacy of PMTCT/ART
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Mhealth Strategies to Optimize Adherence and Efficacy of PMTCT/ART

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are conducting a 3-arm randomized trial comparing the effects of unidirectional SMS (ie: "push" messaging to participant) vs. bidirectional SMS dialogue between participant and provider vs. control (no SMS) among HIV-infected Kenyan mothers in Kenyan PMTCT-ART for outcomes of ART adherence and retention in care.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators will compare trial arms for impact on maternal retention, adherence, virologic failure and resistance and infant HIV or HIV-free survival.
The investigators will determine correlates of maternal loss to follow-up and virologic failure and correlates of infant HIV in the overall study and stratified by trial arm. In the bidirectional SMS arm, the investigators will determine the rate of SMS interactivity, impact of critical time-points on messaging, and characteristics of high and low 'interactors'.
The investigators will determine cost-effectiveness of unidirectional and bidirectional SMS interventions. These data will contribute a potential scale-able strategy to improve PMTCT-ART as programs aspire to 'virtual elimination' of infant HIV.

primary_outcome.measure: The number of participants retained in HIV care programs
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will compare the trial arms for number of participants retained in HIV care programs

primary_outcome.measure: Adherence to ART by self report and pharmacy data
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will compare the trial arms for number of participants adhering to ART measured by the number of doses taken over the number expected. This will be measured with previously validated self report scales and pharmacy refill data.
The investigators will compare trial arms for HIV viral suppression as measured by maternal blood levels of HIV RNA at 6 weeks, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months.

secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will obtain infant testing data from the clinic system throughout follow up.
The investigators will compare the trial arms for infant mortality and infant HIV infection

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal perceptions of intervention and care received Questionnaire

arm_group.description: Participants will receive weekly push SMS messaging with a questions and have the ability to text back to the study nurse
Participants will receive weekly push SMS messaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pregnant, HIV-infected, access to a mobile phone, remaining in study area for two years
Exclusion Criteria:
- enrolled in another research study
